name: monkey-of-death
text: This strip is like everything everyone thinks about Garfield already but said in a hilarious way.

name: saint
text: i told my cousin he "cold had a peter in his mouth" once...he told me to go bench press a boner.

name: werewolves
text: That is some excellent sass.

name: tekende
text: I think he won that round.

name: charchar
text: Props for being man enough to tell us that story, though.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Clearly a master insult swordfighter.

name: theescapist
text: How appropriate, you fight like a cow.

name: sp1derbaby
text: My name is feared in every dirty corner of this island!

name: dracer2
text: So you got that job as janitor, after all.

name: fakedaisies
text: Guybrush Threepwood references? Now I KNOW I belong here.

name: shirt145
text: A cow that I... Boned?

name: shirt145
text: A cow that I... Boned?

name: shirt145
text: Ahh this might have been mildly amusing if only it had not posted twice.  Regrets!

name: dusty
text:
But with your avatar its like

"The cow that I...Boned
WHAT!
The cow that I...Boned
WHAT!"

Add in a drum machine and get p-diddy on it and you've got a hit

name: lordparadise
text: I chubbied you for the Scott Pilgrim reference, even if you weren't set up for it at all, and also it was eleven months ago.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ButterMoths, Deusoma, StagnantDisplay, mercuri0us, Kennisiou, theplaidknight)

name: semiru
text:
I can't be the only one who whispers "up yours Garfield" when I see him on the comic page now, can I?

But yeah, the whole problem with Garfield these days summed up nicely.

name: professorhazard
text:
You won't be the only one now.

I will whisper it so conspiratorially.

name: invidious
text:
You know how to make Garfield funny?
Remove Garfield.

http://garfieldminusgarfield.tumblr.com/

name: fineoakstructure
text: I'd heard about this before, but only checked it today. It is incredible .

name: mr_lostman28
text:
Oh My God! Thats awesome.
It adds such depth to the work. I.. I can't stop reading them.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i should not laugh, but i do...
what is wrong with me.

name: andyk
text: it's sad what garfield has become... normally, i'd stand up for him, but when jim davis isn't even writing the comic and you try to create live action movies on the character... yeah... up yours garfield.

name: catachresis
text: HE DIALS GARFIELD'S NUMBER SO INTENSELY

name: valrus
text: mercilessly even

name: the_doz
text: BEEP BOP DWEEP DWOP DOOP

name: robocop
text: He dials like a white person. probably even licked his finger

name: jaspers
text: It is as if Ray did not dial Garfield's number at all, and yet was convinced in the blind emancipation demanded by his rage that he had somehow reached him by pressing random buttons on the phone-pad.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
all numbers lead to Garfield, kid .
[/Gil]

name: pants
text: ...all sippin the martini, gearin up for the final blow, and damn its a muther

name: ktistecmachine
text:
http://www.garfield.com/comics/comics_archives_strip.html?1989-ga891023

The saddest thing about Garfield is that the strips are his finest dreams.

name: snatch22
text: Holy christ...  That's a very different side of Garfield...

name: never_die
text: Garfield doesn't even care anymore.  He just takes it.  Is so sad.

name: daidai
text: Did...he ever care?

name: nurdbot
text: The casual sipping of the cocktail in the last two panels really sells the moment and comic to me.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Beef's face, bottom left panel. It's like he just saw Santa.

name: shoinan
text: Excellent work Onstad. Note the placement of the signature message between the last two panels, which forces a gap between the last two panels, emphasising the pause Ray takes before telling Garfield what he needs to hear :) All hail the O

name: neitherman
text: "You cold have a peter in your mouth."  5.

name: parity
text: Garfield keeps trying to hang up the phone, Ray won't let him do it.

name: steerpike66
text: It's the 'ssssssip' between 'Hey Garfield' and 'Up yours Garfield' that makes this for me. That and the fcat that Garfield is clearly a fat, dissipated lisping old lush: the Harvey Fierstein of the comic cat world.

name: madrin
text: i think it's brilliant how the whole setup of these strips is a metaphor for how outdated these comics are in relation to the genius that is achewood. when has garfield ever made me laugh spaghetti out of my nose, then lie there laughing even as a i choke on hot bolognaise. the answer: never.

name: honesttom
text: It's like Garfield is John Henry and Ray is the steam drill.

name: erinye
text: As if Garfield is Phineas Gage and Ray is the tamping iron.

name: boredom_man
text: Ray made Garfield beat his wife?

name: molesticide
text: after he sips the martini where does the glass go

name: choosebro
text: He throws it to the ground, or towards a wall, I'm guessing.

name: charchar
text: It goes up Garfield's.  Ray just wills it there.

name: snowman
text: I disagree.  He has shoved it into his mouth.

name: shogun
text:
"You could have a peter in your mouth."

"You have a cold peter in your mouth."

And it still works!

name: speedwell
text: Odie is lucky he didn't answer the phone

name: honesttom
text: I also love Garfield's half-assed attempts at comeback. Guy's been surrounded by yes-men for so long, he just can't deal with this.

name: vandenbos
text: He's just not exactly looking for any INput is all.

name: boheeka
text: it hurts me a little when I laugh at this. When I was a child, I thought garfield was the epitome of sequential art.

name: rowboat
text: Yeah, but when I was, like, five or whatever, I felt the same way about the Family Circus cartoons in which the little boy - Timmy, or whoever - leaves a trail which details his adventures through the backyard. Sometimes I see those and feel a little pang of uncomfortable nostalgia. It's seems so familiar and it briefly returns my mind to a time of comfortable ignorance, but I've come to hate basically all that the strip stands for. It hurts, but we must move on. We simply must.

name: leahpidoptera
text:
This was my first strip.

He is dialing so AGGRESSIVELY!

name: tbtabby
text: Garfield past his prime is still funnier that most other comics on the page...I'm sad to say. Yeah, he's jumped the shark, but he's Douglas Adams compared to shit like Ziggy, Herb & Jamaal, Wizard of Id, BC...look, just go to www.joshreads.com.

name: bixschmix
text: Don't you ever compare Garfield and Douglas Adams. We're not exactly looking for your INput.

name: m-e-charm
text:
Total 5 even if just for the 'You cold have a peter in your mouth.'
That phrase will never tire me.

name: cherubrocker22
text: Man for me Garfield jumped the shark in the first strip pretty much. Maybe I just never gave it enough of a chance, but I can't stand that shit. I'm spoiled by Achewood, but I hated Garfield before Achewood existed. I guess what I'm trying to say is, right on Ray.

name: hellofditties
text: Is it weird that this Garfeild is so different to the one that shops at Perky Pervs?

name: woodenteeth
text: There's actually been a bit of recent commentary that suggests that Onstad doesn't care much for continuity (unless he can use it for seriously witty means).

name: atmus
text: Having a guy lay into you with this magnitude can really mess up a guy.  Ray changed Garfield's outlook on life with this call.

name: snowman
text: For me, it's that he repeats "Garfield" in the last panel.  This strip is brilliant.

name: chachibenji
text:
I love how he even has the Jim Davis-esque copyright and title right in between panels there.
Cold subliminals.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Actually, Onstad just used to have this in most of his strips back then.

name: chachibenji
text: Well shoot in that case man I guess that I am just going to say nothing at all. shoot.

name: eatmorekix
text:
http://www.lasagnacat.com/

http://www.thereverend.com/barfield/

name: watt
text: The finality of a whispered "up yours"...almost tragic for the recipient.

name: troy_convers
text: Ahh the arrogant innocence of a newly minted comic strip genius. Pray you never go the same way as Jim Davis, O...

name: ham_shoes
text:
The dude has no mercy.

Garfield sucks.

name: puguglypress
text: I wanted to give this comic a 4, but I was peer pressured by Assetbar into giving it a 5.

name: lolsworth
text: That is how to end an insulting conversation. Textbook.

name: freakytiki
text:
"WE are not looking for input."
Sweet Christmas, HANG UP RAY, THE ROBOTIC SYNDICATE THAT WRITES GARFIELD IS TRACKING YOU!

name: automin
text: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FpNBAc5W6cM
